cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 315 mi (510 km) SE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west across the central Caribbean, forecast to turn northwest Sunday, then north-northwest over or near western Cuba Monday night and enter the eastern Gulf heading toward Florida’s Gulf Coast mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Gulf Coast (likely Big Bend/west-central coast north of Tampa)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for the U.S. as of Advisory #5
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for the U.S. as of Advisory #5
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from the Keys northward through the Big Bend (including Tampa Bay region)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (with a growing chance of 50-kt and a low but increasing chance of hurricane-force gusts) possible by late Wednesday–Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for >3 ft inundation in Tampa Bay and adjoining coast if Ian approaches from the south with on-shore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands could drop 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts, producing flash and urban flooding in the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas and dangerous surf in Tampa Bay approaches; possible channel shoaling and debris, lightning in feeder bands, and port operational disruptions beginning mid-week.
